questions.question_text: By default, how long is the standard retention period for Time Travel across all Snowflake accounts?

discussion.content: B is correct. The standard retention period is 1 day (24 hours) and is automatically enabled for all Snowflake accounts: For Snowflake Standard Edition, the retention period can be set to 0 (or unset back to the default of 1 day) at the account and object level (i.e. databases, schemas, and tables).

choices.B: Queries with large scans and selective filters
choices.D: Queries of tables that have search optimization service enabled
choices.C: Queries where the GROUP BY has high cardinality

questions.question_text: What type of query will benefit from the query acceleration service?

discussion.content:
B is correct.
Examples of the types of workloads that might benefit from the query acceleration service:

1) Ad hoc analytics.
2) Workloads with unpredictable data volume per query.
3) Queries with large scans and selective filters.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/query-acceleration-service#label-query-acceleration-scale-factor

questions.question_text: How does the search optimization service help Snowflake users improve query performance?

discussion.content:
B Correct .

To improve performance for point lookups, the search optimization service creates and maintains a persistent data structure called a search access path. The search access path keeps track of which values of the table’s columns might be found in each of its micro-partitions, allowing some to be skipped when scanning the table.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/search-optimization-service#how-does-the-search-optimization-service-work

choices.B: It maintains a persistent data structure that keeps track of the values of the table’s columns in each of its micro-partitions.
choices.C: It scans the local disk cache to avoid scans on the tables used in the query.
choices.A: It scans the micro-partitions based on the joins used in the queries and scans only join columns.
choices.D: It keeps track of running queries and their results and saves those extra scans on the table.
Lower the MAX_CONCURRENCY_LEVEL setting for the warehouse.
choices.A: Increase the AUTO_SUSPEND setting for the warehouse.
choices.B: Change the warehouse to a multi-cluster warehouse.

questions.question_text: What can be done to reduce queueing on a virtual warehouse?
What are characteristics of Snowsight worksheets? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
According to documentation: 
You can share worksheets and folders of worksheets with other Snowflake users in your account. 
Each worksheet is a unique session and can use roles different from the role you select 

A is incorrect because you can't nest folders 

Thus B&E

Selected Answer: BE
It's B and E.

Selected Answer: BE
BE
Each worksheet is a separate session with its own id, which you can see if you run SELECT CURRENT_SESSION(); in each sheet.
You can import worksheets as described here: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-snowsight-worksheets-gs#import-worksheets-from-the-sf-legacy-interface-caps
You can share them too: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-snowsight-worksheets-gs

Selected Answer: BC
Not A, folders of folders not possible
B: each worksheet is a unique SF session
C: running one query at once on a worksheet
Not D, session holds on
Not E, import not possible

Selected Answer: CE
You cant create folder of folders
AB : but not in folder of folder

choices.B: Each worksheet is a unique Snowflake session.
choices.C: Users are limited to running only one query on a worksheet.
choices.A: Worksheets can be grouped under folders, and a folder of folders.
choices.D: The Snowflake session ends when a user switches worksheets.
choices.E: Users can import worksheets and share them with other users.
